text: `Plotly.jl` is broken with Julia v1.6 on Windows because their artifact has an executable which isn't executable and they say this is complicated to fix (:shrug:).  the fact is that this used to work before

elements.text: is broken with Julia v1.6 on Windows because their artifact has an executable which isn't executable and they say this is complicated to fix (
).  the fact is that this used to work before

text: it’s because we didn’t use to set the executable permissions as strictly

elements.text: it’s because we didn’t use to set the executable permissions as strictly

text: so tarballs with incorrect permissions wouldn’t have an effect on Windows (they still would on Linux)

elements.text: so tarballs with incorrect permissions wouldn’t have an effect on Windows (they still would on Linux)

text: I understand that now the behaviour is strictly more correct, but things are also going to break because people so far relied on a broken behaviour :confused:

elements.text: I understand that now the behaviour is strictly more correct, but things are also going to break because people so far relied on a broken behaviour

text: The old behavior breaks checksumming, which we also didn’t do on Windows
